title: You lost lane? Stop yelling "ff 15" like the game is over.
body:
Because of course no one would like to help your lane that way.

No one would want to help the lane of a tilted
Player because they think you are not worth helping.

You might not see it, but another lane is winning, so just sit tight, farm up, try to feed as little as possible and be as less of a burden on your team as you can.

Don't cry in chat and spam ping the jungler "?".
Genuinely call for help and show your team you want to win this game.

You probably can't 1v1 any of the enemies because you are behind, so don't try.
It will only make things worse.

Learn to get carried when you lose lane and you will win more games.

It's all mentality.

replies.body: Mental booming in this game is far more common now than I've ever seen. Like not even a joke majority of my losses are because people just mental boom and give up

> [{quoted}](name=BrightWîngs,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=94fthUB8,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-09-07T20:20:37.899+0000)
>
> Mental booming in this game is far more common now than I've ever seen. Like not even a joke majority of my losses are because people just mental boom and give up

I've even had teammates surrender when I'm something like 7/1/3, on a late game champ, all because they personally weren't doing well. Most people seem to have the mindset that they must personally carry or all is lost. It's as if the concept of supporting the team is completely lost on them.

I have gone through uncountable games with my team screaming abuse because i refuse to surrender, and won roughly half of those games because i correctly called that we would scale and catch up.

Surrender, especially in ranked, is not a valid choice unless the game is completely over, like your nexus being attacked with 50 seconds of respawn to go.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=94fthUB8,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-09-07T20:26:43.347+0000)
>
>  and won roughly half of those games 

Unless you're a smurf playing at least 4 tiers below your skill level, I call bullshit.

You only win about 1 in 40 of those games. If you don't believe me, write down the stats yourself. Every time you're in a game where your team feeds out of control, record it and record the ones where you've made a comeback. You would be surprised at how in almost none of those games, you actually made a comeback.
I keep detailed stats of my winrates per champion and game conditions, so i dont really give a fuck if you think it is bullshit. Your attitude is why you lose those games, obviously.

I don't care what the fuck you say. You are not winning half of all "5-25 by 15 minutes" games. You're straight up bullshitting us. You're boldly lying about those stats to justify an out-dated "never ff" attitude towards losing games.

If I lose lane, the very next thing I do is look to see if any of my other lanes are winning. If not, it's best to just surrender. In many match ups, especially in bot lane, dying even once means gg for your lane.
Don't tell me what to do.

back when i played i absolutely refused to surrender a game. surrendering is outright disrespectful to everyone in the game and shows that you refuse to play if you can't win. in my time of playing i have only surrendered twice. once cause it was ARURF and we were getting waffle stomped by a yi. and a second time i was way too tired to keep the game going and was on the verge on sleeping on the keyboard. but most of the time i will not surrender. no matter what the score is.
3 ganks vs 0 in a vision limited meta means you probably should do something.

Issue being come backs don’t happen. As soon as you’ve lost your lane (died even once) your game is done. No one wants to sit there meat in hand hoping their laner fucks up hard enough to give them a glimmer of a chance to come back (they won’t)

Normally I’m the person to call ff15 in un-winnable games although in most cases I punish my team for not listening to my call outs and feeding their asses off :|. 

A complete opposite game was where my bot lane was hard feeding their lane going 0/3/0 ADC and 0/5/0 support. Since the enemy bot lane was fed but clearly not skilled at the game I was easily able to pressure other lanes as Kha’zix, steal kills for proper reasons, easily obliterate the enemy jungled being a nocturne and hard carry the game.... going a perfect score 12/0/14 (something like that).
